intro: Dipteracanthus ciliosus, commonly known as the silky broom. It is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, characterized by its delicate, feathery foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal species. Its leaves are often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft, velvety appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
